TopicTitle: Tell me if I can install this list of mods

Articles.Content:
Hi guys i've made a list of mod while i was searching on internet the popular mods . I'm playing this game from about 3 months but I've never used a mod so tell me if this list is good to start and if I can install it without compatibily problems (sorry for my english) . Thank you for all .

This is the image with the list of mods : http://puu.sh/a2x0U/8eb3f3dc0f.jpg

Or you can watch it there :

Ps : I also want to ask you help for the graphics mods, I've found this :

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/76972-0-23-5-KSPRC-Renaissance-Compilation-artworks-remake-V-0-1-515-UPDATED-29-4-14

but I think that is too heavy for my computer especially hot rockets. (when I launch a rocket the fps drop me to 7...) so tell me what can I cut off from that list.

If you're installing RSS, I highly recommend installing the Realism Overhaul suite of mods. KSP's fuel tanks and engines are far, far less efficient than real life ones, and also the sizes of pods and the like are far too small for their mass. This means (a) you will need far more rocket for a given payload, and ( reentries will be much harder than they should be since your ballistic coefficient will be higher.

Also, you're definitely going to need Active Texture Management; otherwise KSP might not even load. This is because KSP loads *everything* into memory when it starts up, and will crash if memory usage goes over ~3.4GB (it's a 32bit application).
Okay thank you! Now can u please tell me a list of the best graphics mod to put with active texture management??
If you're using RSS, you're going to want the latest EVE Overhaul and pingopete's RSS EVE Enhancements (available in the Add on Development forum).

B9 and KW Rocketry could be a problem, since they add more parts. Dunno about Interstellar, but mods with a lot of parts, could be a problem (no 64-bit yet)

Edit: NathanKell already said it, you need ATM.
